subject: Re: File - JUnit FAQ.txt
msgSnippet: ... The excluded.properties file must be in the same package as it is in the junit.jar file. So you could put it in mystuff/junit/runner/excluded.properties
messageBody:
Oren Gross wrote:

>Thanks Mike, but this is actually what I used... so, no it doesn't help.
>I edited the excluded.properties, and put it in the classpath before the
>junit.jar (as the FAQ states... "place your customized version in the
>CLASSPATH before junit.jar"), and still no go!
>

The excluded.properties file must be in the same package as it is in the
junit.jar file.

So you could put it in

mystuff/junit/runner/excluded.properties

and then add 'mystuff' in the CLASSPATH before junit.jar.

Mike
